    Unicode_Entities._unpackword — Function.

    Internal function to unpack the packed Unicode entity names

    Unicode has a very limited character set for the entity names, 0-9, A-Z, -, (, and ). ( and ) are only used for 4 names, so those are special cased to store in the word table.

    0 represents a space, when needed between characters 1 represents a hyphen 2-11 represents the digits 0-9 12-37 represents the letters A-Z 38-53 represents up to 16*256 words stored in the wrd2 table 54-255 represent 202 words stored in the wrd1 table
